channel.title: Server help
channel.description:
Not sure if this is in the right section.
I've portforwarded from my computer which is fine, players are able to connect and the server becomes online. But when I attempt to portforward on my laptop it wont turn my server online (I close everything on the computer). I used to be able to portforward from my laptop but for some reason it wont let me, I've allowed 43594 port be able to pass through my firewall.
Anyone know what's up with that?

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You shouldn’t have to do all that from your laptop if its running on your family computer, since your are acting like another regular player trying to connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

Yeah.

I’ve added the environment variables, created port 43594 in my firewall exceptions and ticked it, I’ve created the port in my modem and made sure the firewall is inactive on it. I run my DUC then my run.bat but it’ll still say my serve is offline. (Around 5 days ago there was no problems). I’ve done the exact same thing on my computer but that says my server is online.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

That wouldn’t be a port forwarding issue, do you have the no-ip DUC on you computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

When it’s all fine when I run it, no errors but When I check a server status it’ll say:
“myserver.no-ip.biz is offline” and no players are able to connect.

When I run it off my computer it’s all still the same but when I check it says:
“myserver.no-ip.biz if online” and my players log in then.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ok, I got everything all the way up to your last sentence, when it does not “turn on” does the run.bat not open, or does it not connect, what does CMD show?

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

Like when you run the run.bat in the sources file your server turns online (using either port 5555 or 43594) when portforwarding correctly. I’ve set this up on my computer, when I run the source (run.bat) it turns my server online (using No-IP etc). But when I do this on my laptop (I’ve done the exact same thing as I did for my computer) it doesn’t turn on my server.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

RealmofOmens:

When I run it on the family computer it can turn online, when I run it on my laptop it doesn’t turn online.

What do you mean it doesn’t turn “online” is their an error?

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

I’ve got JDK7 on both my laptop & computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Download JDK 27 on your laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

When I run it on the family computer it can turn online, when I run it on my laptop it doesn’t turn online.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You have already port forwarded from your router, so that’s fine, is the server running on the family comp.?

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

My computer is a family computer were as my laptop is just mine. So it doesn’t give me much time to edit the server. Plus I can’t log in on my laptop because my No-Ip is coming from the same IP address and when I switch it too 127.0.0.1 it wont let me connect because there is no source running on my laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

you port-forward through your router tho… It shouldn’t depend on you computer.

Read full topic

I’ve portforwarded from my computer which is fine, players are able to connect and the server becomes online. But when I attempt to portforward on my laptop it wont turn my server online (I close everything on the computer).
